Package org.logevents

Interface LogEventConfigurator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultLogEventConfigurator, DefaultTestLogEventConfigurator
    public interface LogEventConfigurator
    Implement this interface and specify your implementation class in META-INF/services/org.logevents.LogEventConfigurator to automatically load you own configuration with ServiceLoader at startup. Your implementation may want to inherit from DefaultLogEventConfigurator.

    How to implement your own configuration

    1. At any point in your code, you can access get LogEventFactory.getInstance() and call LogEventFactory.addObserver(Logger, LogEventObserver) to add an observer that you created programmatically to a logger or LogEventFactory.setFilter(Logger, LogEventFilter) or LogEventFactory.setLevel(Logger, Level) to adjust what is being logged
    2. You can add your own subclass of DefaultLogEventConfigurator with a service loader and override DefaultLogEventConfigurator.createGlobalObservers(LogEventFactory, Map, Map) to programmatically add observers to the root logger
    3. You can override DefaultLogEventConfigurator.createObservers(Map, Map, Map) to create named observers that you can refer from logger.org.example=... configuration in logevents.properties
    4. You can also override DefaultLogEventConfigurator.configureLoggers(LogEventFactory, Map, Map) to programmatically modify which observers and filters are applied to loggers
    5. You can override DefaultLogEventConfigurator.loadConfigurationProperties() to add configuration properties from your own sources
    6. You can fully implement LogEventConfigurator to take full control of your configuration
    Author:
    Johannes Brodwall
